list_definition.definition: (of) a very hard alloy of iron and carbon, used for making tools etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He had a grip of steel (= a very strong grip).

list_definition.definition: to harden and strengthen (oneself, one’s nerves etc) in preparation for doing, or resisting, something

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He steeled himself to meet the attack / to tell his wife the truth.

list_ex_of_english: We have already taken some action in respect of special steels.
I am interested only in the special steels sector for the engineering industry.
There, are already widespread shortages of certain steels.
I assume he was referring more particularly to the alloy steels, the special steels, where a recession has been shown.
The regime does not apply to special steels.
To fabricate these special steels to the very high degree of accuracy required calls for training and experience.
Substantial investment is continuing to take place in both the public and private sectors of the special steels industry.
There is a deeper, richer, more enduring compassion, the compassion which steels a man to do his duty.
